descr.p: The unit relies on having relevant Unicode collation data linked in the binary. The Unicode data is managed using the routines in the unicodedata unit. The FPC project distributes some Unicode collation data in .bco files which can be loaded using the LoadCollation routines. The LoadCollation is the main routine of this unit.

All collation data requires at least the Default Unicode Collation Element Table to be registered (called DUCET). The DUCET encoding is provided by the unicodeducet unit, part of the rtl-Unicode package.
There are two ways to register collations :

ol.li: at compile time: by including the desired collation unit, for example for Russian and Japanese languages to be available you will have to include collation_ru and collation_ja from package "rtl-unicode".
at runtime using the above mentioned LoadCollation function.

descr.p: The two ways can co-exist: some collations may be compile time included (for example for most used collations) and others can be loaded at runtime in the same application.
The binary collation files are endian sensitive:

ul.li: there are files for little endian systems named collation_lang_le.bco (such as collation_ru_le.bco and collation_ja_le.bco)
there are files for big endian systems named collation_lang_be.bco (such as collation_ru_be.bco and collation_ja_be.bco).

descr.p: Note that the compile time units collation units (collation_lang.pas) include already the unicodeducet.pas (DUCET) unit so it is not necessary to include it manually, contrary to the binary files. So an application that only uses the binary collation files should at least include the unicodeducet unit or manually load the binary collation collation_ducet_le.bco or collation_ducet_be.bco, depending on the endianness of the platform. The call using a directory and the language ducet automatically select the correct file.

element.name: MAX_WORD
element.short: Maximum value of a WORD typed value
element.descr: MAX_WORD is the maximum value of a WORD typed value.

element.name: LOW_SURROGATE_BEGIN
element.short: First value for low surrogate values.

element.name: LOW_SURROGATE_END
element.short: Last value for low surrogate values.

element.name: HIGH_SURROGATE_BEGIN
element.short: First value for high surrogate values.

element.name: HIGH_SURROGATE_END
element.short: Last value for high surrogate values.

element.name: MAX_LEGAL_UTF32
element.short: Maximum value of a legally encoded UTF32 value (currently unused)

element.name: UGC_PrivateUse
element.short: Unicode token category: For private use

element.name: UGC_Unassigned
element.short: Unicode token category: As yet unassigned

element.name: TUInt24Rec
element.descr: Unicode data exists mostly of 24-bit data (3 bytes). This type is meant to deal efficiently with this data. it has members to split out the data in bytes, and functions to query the various properties stored in the data.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.implicit(TUInt24Rec):Cardinal
element.descr: Assign to cardinal, byte0 to MSB and so on.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.implicit(TUInt24Rec):LongInt
element.descr: Assign to cardinal, byte0 to MSB and so on.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.implicit(TUInt24Rec):Word
element.descr: Assign to word, byte0 to MSB, byte1 to MSB.
element.errors: If the value is too big (>$FFFF) to be assigned, an overflow error occurs.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.implicit(TUInt24Rec):Byte
element.descr: Assign to byte, byte0 is assigned.
element.errors: If the value is too big (>$FF) to be assigned, an overflow error occurs.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.implicit(Cardinal):TUInt24Rec
element.descr: Assign from cardinal, byte0 to MSB.
element.errors: If the value is too big (>$FFFFFF) to be assigned, an overflow error occurs.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.descr: The 2 records are considered equal if the 3 bytes are equal.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean
element.short: Check if cardinal and TUInt24Rec are equal
element.descr: The cardinal b is considered equal to a if the fourth byte (LSB) is zero, and the first three bytes equal byte0, byte1, and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value equals a cardinal value.
element.descr: The cardinal a is considered equal to b if the fourth byte (LSB) is zero, and the first three bytes equal byte0, byte1, and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,LongInt):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value equals a longint value.
element.descr: The longint b is considered equal to a if the fourth byte (LSB) is zero, and the first three bytes equal byte0, byte1, and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,LongInt):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(LongInt,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value equals a longint value.
element.descr: The longint a is considered equal to b if the fourth byte (LSB) is zero, and the first three bytes equal byte0, byte1, and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(LongInt,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,Word):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value equals a word value.
element.descr: The word b is considered equal to a if its 2 bytes equal byte0, byte1 and byte2 is zero.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,Word):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(Word,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value equals a word value.
element.descr: The word a is considered equal to b if its 2 bytes equal byte0, byte1 and byte2 is zero.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(Word,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,Byte):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value equals a byte value.
element.descr: The byte b is considered equal to a if it equals byte0 and byte1 and byte1 are zero.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(TUInt24Rec,Byte):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(Byte,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value equals a byte value.
element.descr: The byte b is considered equal to a if it equals byte0 and byte1 and byte1 are zero.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.equal(Byte,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are equal

element.name: TUInt24Rec.notequal(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.notequal(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are different

element.name: TUInt24Rec.notequal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value differs from a cardinal value.
element.descr: The cardinal a is considered not equal to b if the fourth byte (LSB) is nonzero, or one of the first three bytes differ from byte0, byte1, and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.notequal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are different

element.name: TUInt24Rec.notequal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value differs from a cardinal value.
element.descr: The cardinal a is considered not equal to b if the fourth byte (LSB) is nonzero, or one of the first three bytes differ from byte0, byte1, and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.notequal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a and b are different

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthan(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is greater than another TUInt24Rec value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthan(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is greater than b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthan(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is greater than a cardinal value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthan(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is greater than b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthan(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a cardinal value is greater than a TUInt24Rec value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthan(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is greater than b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is greater than or equal to a cardinal value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is greater than or equal to b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is greater than or equal to a cardinal value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is greater than or equal to b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthanorequal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a cardinal value is greater than or equal to a TUInt24Rec value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.greaterthanorequal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is greater than or equal to b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthan(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is less than another TUInt24Rec value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing the bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthan(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is less than b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthan(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is less than a cardinal value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthan(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is less than b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthan(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a cardinal value is less than a TUInt24Rec value

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthan(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is less than b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is less than or equal to another TUInt24Rec value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing the bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is less than or equal to b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a TUInt24Rec value is less than or equal to a cardinal value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthanorequal(TUInt24Rec,Cardinal):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is less than or equal to b

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthanorequal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean
element.short: Check whether a cardinal value is less than or equal to a TUInt24Rec value
element.descr: The comparison is done by comparing 3 first bytes of the cardinal value with bytes byte0, byte1 and byte2.

element.name: TUInt24Rec.lessthanorequal(Cardinal,TUInt24Rec):Boolean.Result
element.short: True if a is less than or equal to b

element.name: ZERO_UINT24
element.descr: TUInt24Rec value with all bytes zero.

element.name: TUC_Prop
element.descr: TUC_Prop describes the collation characteristics of a unicode character. It is an internal structure which should not be used directly, the actual structure is subject to change.

element.name: TUC_Prop.CategoryData
element.descr: CategoryData is a bitmask encoding various characteristics of the unicode character.

element.name: TUC_Prop.CCC
element.descr: CategoryData is a bitmask encoding various characteristics of the unicode character.

element.name: TUC_Prop.Category
element.descr: CategoryData provides access to the category part of CategoryData (encoded).

element.name: TUC_Prop.WhiteSpace
element.descr: Whitespace provides easy access to the Whitespace part of CategoryData (encoded).

element.name: TUC_Prop.HangulSyllable
element.short: Is the character a hangul syllable
element.descr: Whitespace provides easy access to the HangulSyllable part of CategoryData (encoded).

element.name: TUC_Prop.NumericValue
element.descr: NumericValue uses numericalindex to get the numerical value.

element.name: TUCA_PropWeights
element.descr: TUC_PropWeights describes the weights of collation characteristics of a unicode character. It is an internal structure which should not be used directly, the actual structure is subject to change.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextRec
element.short: Internal structure for unicode collation data encoding.
element.descr: This is an internal structure which should not be used directly, the actual structure is subject to change.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextRec.GetCodePoints
element.short: get the address of actual code points.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextRec.GetWeights
element.short: Get the Address of actual weights.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeNodeRec
element.short: Internal tree node structure for sorted storage of unicode collation data.
element.descr: This is an internal structure for the tree which should not be used directly, the actual structure is subject to change.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeNodeRec.Left
element.short: Offset of left branch of the tree

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeNodeRec.Right
element.short: Offset of right branch of the tree

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeNodeRec.GetLeftNode
element.short: Access to left tree node data

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeNodeRec.GetRightNode
element.short: Access to right tree node data

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeRec
element.short: Internal tree structure for sorted storage of unicode collation data
element.descr: This is an internal tree structure for storing unicode collation data which should not be used directly, the actual structure is subject to change.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeRec.GetData
element.short: Access to tree data (getter for Data property)

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeRec.Find
element.descr: Find searches the tree for the collation data for the character encoded in AChars (ACharCount). It returns true if the data was found, false if not. A pointer to the collation data is returned in ANode.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemContextTreeRec.Find.Result
element.short: True if collation data was found

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec
element.descr: TUCA_PropItemRec encodes 1 entry from the Unicode Collation data in an encoded form.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.HasCodePoint
element.short: Check flags whether a codepoint is present.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.HasCodePoint.Result
element.short: True if a codepoint is present.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.CodePoint
element.descr: Access to codepoint if HasCodePoint returns true. If HasCodePoint returns false, an exception will be raised.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.IsValid.Result
element.short: true if the flags validity bit is set

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.GetWeightArray
element.descr: GetWeightArray returns an array with the weights in ADest. ADest must point to enough room for WeightLength weights.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.GetWeightArray.ADest
element.short: Memory location to which weight data will be copied.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.GetSelfOnlySize
element.short: Size of this item data (in bytes).
element.descr: Return the size of the item's data and properties.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.GetContextual
element.short: Check if the contextual bit is set in the flags (getter for Contextual)

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.GetContextual.Result
element.short: True if the bit is set.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.Contextual
element.short: Check if the contextual bit is set in the flags

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.GetContext
element.descr: GetContext returns a pointer to the context data. It is Nil if the context flag is not set.

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.IsDeleted
element.short: Check flags if deleted bit is set

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.IsDeleted.Result
element.short: True if the deleted bit is set

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.IsWeightCompress_1
element.short: Check whether weight compression flag 1 is set

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.IsWeightCompress_1.Result
element.short: True if weight compression flag 1 is set

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.IsWeightCompress_2
element.short: Check whether weight compression flag 2 is set

element.name: TUCA_PropItemRec.IsWeightCompress_2.Result
element.short: True if weight compression flag 2 is set

element.name: TUCA_VariableKind.ucaShifted
element.short: Variable collation elements are reset to zero at levels one through three

element.name: TUCA_VariableKind.ucaNonIgnorable
element.short: Variable collation elements are not reset to be quaternary collation elements

element.name: TUCA_VariableKind.ucaBlanked
element.short: Variable collation elements and any subsequent ignorable collation elements are reset so that all weights (except for the identical level) are zero

element.name: TUCA_VariableKind.ucaShiftedTrimmed
element.short: This option is the same as Shifted, except that all trailing FFFFs are trimmed from the sort key.

element.name: TUCA_VariableKind.ucaIgnoreSP
element.short: Not implemented (variant of Shifted that reduces the set of variable collation elements to include only spaces and punctuation)

element.name: TUCA_DataBook
element.descr: TUCA_DataBook describes a Unicode Collation Algorithm data set. data sets can be registered using the function or loaded from file using . A collation data book must be specified when comparing unicode strings.

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.Base
element.short: Collation set on which this collation set is based.

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.Backwards
element.short: Is the collation weighting in backwards direction

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.BMP_Table1
element.short: Basic Multilingual Plane Data, table 1 (code points U+0000..U+FFFF)

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.BMP_Table2
element.short: Basic Multilingual Plane Data, table 2 (code points U+0000..U+FFFF)

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.OBMP_Table1
element.short: Data for code points above U+FFFF, table 1

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.OBMP_Table2
element.short: Data for code points above U+FFFF, table 2

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.PropCount
element.short: Property count (number of items in table)

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.Dynamic
element.short: Indicates the data was loaded from file (True) or is compiled-in (False).

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.IsVariable
element.short: Check if a weight is a variable weight
element.descr: IsVariable checks whether AWeight is between the VariableLowLimit and VariableHighLimit limits.

element.name: TUCA_DataBook.IsVariable.Result
element.short: True if the weight is in the variable range.

element.name: TCollationField
element.descr: TCollationField describes some properties of the collation data items.

element.name: TCollationField.VariableLowLimit
element.short: Has lower bound on variable weights

element.name: TCollationField.VariableHighLimit
element.short: Has upper bound on variable weights

element.name: ROOT_COLLATION_NAME
element.short: Name of the root collation (used if no collation name is given)

element.name: FromUCS4
element.descr: FromUCS4 converts the UCS4 encoded unicode character AValue to a set of unicode (surrogate pair) characters encoded in UTF16: AHighS, ALowS.

element.name: ToUCS4
element.short: Encode unicode UTF16 surrogate pair to UCS4 character
element.descr: ToUCS4 converts set of unicode (surrogate pair) characters encoded in UTF16: AHighS, ALowS to a UCS4 encoded unicode character.

element.name: UnicodeIsSurrogatePair
element.short: Check if a pair of UTF16 encoded characters is a valid surrogate pair.
element.descr: UnicodeIsSurrogatePair checks whether AHighSurrogate,ALowSurrogate constitute a valid surrogate pair, and returns True if this is the case. It does this by checking whether the values are within the bounds for high and low surrogate pairs.

element.name: UnicodeIsSurrogatePair.Result
element.short: True if AHighSurrogate,ALowSurrogate are a valid surrogate pair

element.name: UnicodeIsSurrogatePair.AHighSurrogate
element.short: High character in the surrogate pair

element.name: UnicodeIsSurrogatePair.ALowSurrogate
element.short: Low character in the surrogate pair

element.name: UnicodeIsHighSurrogate
element.short: Check if a UTF16 character is the high character in a surrogate pair.
element.descr: UnicodeIsHighSurrogate checks whether AValue is a valid high character of a surrogate pair, and returns True if this is the case. It does this by checking whether the values are within the bounds for high characters in surrogate pairs.

element.name: UnicodeIsHighSurrogate.Result
element.short: True if AValue forms the high character of a surrogate pair

element.name: UnicodeIsLowSurrogate
element.short: Check if a UTF16 character is the low character in a surrogate pair.
element.descr: UnicodeIsHighSurrogate checks whether AValue is a valid high character of a surrogate pair, and returns True if this is the case. It does this by checking whether the values are within the bounds for high characters in surrogate pairs.

element.name: UnicodeIsLowSurrogate.Result
element.short: True if AValue forms the low character of a surrogate pair

element.name: UnicodeToUpper

descr.p: UnicodeToUpper transforms a UTF16 unicode string AString to its uppercase equivalent and returns this in AResultString. If the transformation was successful, then the function returns 0. A nonzero return value means an error occurred. AResultString will remain untouched in that case.

If a character in AString cannot be found in the unicode data tables, an error will be reported, unless AIgnoreInvalidSequence is set to True, in which case the character will be copied as-is to the output.
Unicode collation data can be loaded using or

element.errors: On error, a nonzero value will be returned.

element.name: UnicodeToUpper.Result
element.short: Zero if all went well, nonzero indicates an error.

element.name: UnicodeToUpper.AIgnoreInvalidSequence
element.short: Set to true to ignore invalid characters.

element.name: UnicodeToLower

descr.p: UnicodeToLower transforms a UTF16 unicode string AString to its lowercase equivalent and returns this in AResultString. If the transformation was successful, then the function returns 0. A nonzero return value means an error occurred. AResultString will remain untouched in that case.

If a character in AString cannot be found in the unicode data tables, an error will be reported, unless AIgnoreInvalidSequence is set to True, in which case the character will be copied as-is to the output.
Unicode collation data can be loaded using or

element.errors: On error, a nonzero value will be returned.

element.name: UnicodeToLower.Result
element.short: Zero if all went well, nonzero indicates an error.

element.name: UnicodeToLower.AIgnoreInvalidSequence
element.short: Set to true to ignore invalid characters.

descr.p: GetProps returns a pointer to a general unicode character property data structure. The character can be specified using a word or cardinal sized codepoint (ACodePoint), or using a UTF16 encoded surrogate pair (AHighS,ALowS).
The returned pointer must not be freed, it points to part of a static structure.

element.name: GetProps.AHighS
element.short: High character in a UTF16 surrogate pair

element.name: GetProps.ALowS
element.short: Low character in a UTF16 surrogate pair

element.name: GetPropUCA
element.short: Get unicode collation algorithm properties for a unicode character
element.descr: GetPropUCA returns UCA data for the unicode character (AChar) or surrogate pair AHighS, ALowS) in the collation data book ABook. If no data is available, Nil is returned.
element.errors: if an invalid ABook is specified, an access violation may occur.

element.name: GetPropUCA.Result
element.short: UCA data for the character, nil if none is available.

element.name: NormalizeNFD
element.short: Perform unicode normalization D on a string
element.descr: NormalizeNFD normalizes the string AString (or the alternate form using a null-terminated AStr with length Alength) to Unicode Normalization Form D. The resulting string can be used to determine equivalence of unicode strings.

element.name: NormalizeNFD.AStr
element.short: Null-terminated string with length specified in ALength.

element.name: CanonicalOrder
element.short: Put unicode string in canonical order.
element.descr: CanonicalOrder transforms a unicode string AString (or the alternate form using a null-terminated AStr with length Alength) so it is in canonical order (as defined by the unicode specification). A string needs to be in canonical order to be able to compare strings. This function is called as part of .

element.name: CanonicalOrder.AStr
element.short: Null-terminated string with length specified in ALength.

element.name: ComputeSortKey
element.short: Compute the sort key for a string
element.descr: ComputeSortKey computes the sort key for a unicode string AString (or the alternate form using a null-terminated AStr with length Alength) using the Unicode Collation Algorithm data in ACollation. This key can then be used in to compare unicode strings.

element.name: ComputeSortKey.ACollation
element.short: Unicode Collation Algorithm data to use.

element.name: ComputeSortKey.AStr
element.short: Null-terminated string with length specified in ALength.

descr.p: CompareSortKey compares 2 sort keys A and B. It returns

ul.li: a negative number if A comes alphabetically ordered before B.
Zero if A is alphabetically identical to B.
A positive number if A is alphabetically ordered after B.

descr.p: Sort keys can be constructed from unicode strings using .

element.name: CompareSortKey.Result
element.short: A signed number determining how A and B are alphabetically ordered.

element.name: IncrementalCompareString
element.short: Compare 2 strings using the specified collation
element.descr: IncrementalCompareString creates 2 compare keys from the strings AStrA and AStrB using collation data in ACollation. The keys are computed only to the point where the two strings differ. This means the keys cannot be reused for other comparisons if the strings differ. The two strings can be specified as a unicode string or as a pointer to a null-terminated character array with a length (ALengthA and ALengthB). It returns then the result of .

element.name: IncrementalCompareString.Result
element.short: A signed integer indicating the alphabetic order of AStrA and AStrB.

descr.p: RegisterCollation registers a new collation ACollation in the list of known collations. The collation data can be specified directly (ACollation) or a name of a language (ALanguage) in a directory (ADirectory). The latter option will load the binary encoded collation from file using .
If the collation is loaded correctly, True is returned, otherwise False is returned (for instance when a collation with the same name is already loaded).

element.name: RegisterCollation.Result
element.short: True if the collation is registered correctly.

element.name: RegisterCollation.ACollation
element.short: Pointer to collation data in memory

element.name: RegisterCollation.ADirectory
element.short: Directory to search for ALanguage collation data.

element.name: UnregisterCollation
element.short: Remove a collation from the list of known collections.
element.descr: UnRegisterCollation removes a collation AName from the list of known collations. It returns True if the collation was found and successfully removed.
element.errors: If the collation was not found, False is returned.

element.name: UnregisterCollation.Result
element.short: True if the collation was found and successfully removed

element.name: UnregisterCollations
element.descr: UnregisterCollations unregisters all known collations. If AFreeDynamicCollations is True, then dynamic collations will be removed from memory using . This must normally be set to true.

element.name: UnregisterCollations.AFreeDynamicCollations
element.short: Should dynamic collations be freed from memory ?

element.name: FindCollation
element.descr: FindCollection searches a collation with name AName or index AIndex in the list of known collations and returns a pointer to the collation data. If the requested collation is not known, i.e. the name is not found, or the index is out of range, then Nil is returned. The valid index range is 0 to GetCollationCount-1.

element.name: GetCollationCount
element.short: Return the number of known collations.
element.descr: GetCollationCount returns the number of registered collations. The collation data can be retrieved by index using the . The maximum index is GetCollationCount-1.

element.name: PrepareCollation
element.short: Prepare a collation for use in the list

descr.p: PrepareCollation will link collation definition ACollation to the base collection with name ABaseName (if empty, it defaults to the root collation). It will also initialize some fields in the definition, copying them from the base collation, but excludes the fields enumerated in AChangedFields.
It should normally not be needed to call this function, it is called as part of .

element.name: PrepareCollation.AChangedFields
element.short: Changed fields, which should not be initialized

element.name: LoadCollation
element.short: Load a binary collation data file from file

descr.p: LoadCollation loads collation data from file AFileName, or from a memory block AData with length ADataLength. If successful, it returns a pointer which can be used to register the collation using . if there is a problem with the data, Nil is returned.

The filename can also be specified as a Directory and language name ALanguage. The latter is prepended with collation_ and appended with the native endianness of the current platform, and has extension .bco

element.errors: If the file containing data does not exist or has a size which is less than the encoded header size, Nil is returned.

element.name: LoadCollation.AData
element.short: Memory area containing encoded collation data

element.name: LoadCollation.ALanguage
element.short: Language for which to load collation.

element.name: FreeCollation
element.descr: FreeCollation removes all structures in the collation data from memory. It will not do anything when the header field Dynamic is false. (collations loaded and registered using are always dynamic and must be freed).

element.name: TEndianKind
element.descr: TEndianKind is an auxiliary enumerated type to enumerate the endianness of platforms.

element.name: ENDIAN_SUFFIX
element.descr: ENDIAN_SUFFIX contains the suffixes used in when constructing a collation filename for a language.

element.name: SCollationNotFound
element.short: Error message when a collation is not found.
